description: Biomineralization, the process by which mineralized tissues grow and harden via biogenic mineral deposition,  is  a  relatively  lengthy process  in  many  mineral-producing  organisms,resulting  in challenges  to  study  the  growth  and  biomineralization  of  complex  hard  mineralized  tissues. In this study we  used  the  dactyl  club  of  stomatopods (mantis  shrimps)as  a  model  structure  to  study  the entire formation of hard and tough mineralized appendages. Proteomics analysis was performed prior mineralization process on freshly molted cuticle.

terms.name: Reference
terms.value: Amini S, Tadayon M, Loke JJ, Kumar A, Kanagavel D, Le Ferrand H, Duchamp M, Raida M, Sobota RM, Chen L, Hoon S, Miserez A A diecast mineralization process forms the tough mantis shrimp dactyl club. Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2019 Apr 11;

title: A Diecast Mineralization Process Forms the Tough Mantis Shrimp Dactyl Club
